[[File:Lebanese passport.jpg|thumb|The front cover of a contemporary Lebanese machine-readable passport]]
'''Visa requirements for citizens of the Republic of Lebanon''' are administrative entry restrictions by the authorities of other [[List of sovereign states|sovereign countries]] and territories placed on citizens of the Republic of [[Lebanon]].
In February 2016, citizens of the Republic of [[Lebanon]] had visa-free or visa on arrival access to 39 [[List of sovereign states|sovereign countries]] and territories, ranking the [[Lebanese passport]] 96th in the world according to the [[Visa (document)#Visa restrictions|Visa Restrictions Index]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Global Ranking - Visa Restriction Index 2015|url=https://www.henleyglobal.com/files/download/HP/hvri/HP%20Visa%20Restrictions%20Index%20160223.pdf|publisher=Henley & Partners|accessdate=25 February 2016}}</ref>Additionally, [https://www.passportindex.org Passport Index Organization] also ranked the Lebanese passport as 86th in the world in terms of travel freedom.<ref>https://www.passportindex.org/byRank.php</ref>
Citizens of the Republic of [[Lebanon]] do not need a passport when traveling to [[Jordan]] and [[Syria]]. For these countries, they may use just their domestic national identification cards called ([[Arabic language|Arabic]]: بطاقة الهوية (''bițāqat al-hawiya''); [[French language|French]]: ''Carte nationale d'identité'').
Besides visa requirements, most countries specify other requirements which preclude the entry of citizens of the Republic of [[Lebanon]] and other citizens into their country, for example the prospective entrant has a criminal history, health issues, evidence of sufficient funds, evidence of ticket for exit or many other factors.
==Recent Changes== Recently visa requirements for citizens of the Republic of [[Lebanon]] were lifted by [[Turkey]] (January 11, 2010),<ref>[http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/default.aspx?pageid=438&n=lebanese-prime-minister-visits-turkey-2010-01-11]</ref> [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] (March 23, 2012),<ref>[https://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Local-News/2012/Mar-23/167672-georgia-to-lift-visa-restrictions-for-lebanese.ashx]</ref> [[Iran]] (July 29, 2015),<ref>[http://www.alaraby.co.uk/english/news/2015/7/29/iran-waives-visa-requirements-for-egypt-lebanon-syria-nationals]</ref> and [[Indonesia]]. (October 7, 2015)<ref>[http://www.antaranews.com/en/news/100865/president-jokowi-signs-decree-for-visa-free-facility-for-75-countries]</ref>
[[Antigua and Barbuda]] and [[Tajikistan]] introduced an Electronic Visa facility for citizens of the Republic of [[Lebanon]] on 3 July 2016 and 3 June 2016 respectively.<ref>http://www.immigration.gov.ag</ref><ref name="evisa.tj">https://www.evisa.tj</ref><ref>http://mfa.tj/ru/novosti-i-sobytiya/o-vvedenii-sistemy-vydachi-elektronnoy-vizy.html</ref>
==Visa requirements map==
[[File:Visa requirements for Lebanese citizens.png|thumb|800px|center|Fully internationally recognized countries and territories with visa-free or visa-on-arrival regime for holders of regular Lebanese passports Type (P) {{legend|#006600|Visa is not required for tourism and business purposes}}{{legend|#00C100|Visa is granted on arrival}}{{legend|#84FF84|Visa is granted on arrival under limited circumstances}}{{legend|#2F74E8|Electronic Authorization or Electronic Visa}}{{legend|#C0C0C0|Pre-arranged visa is required and should be obtained from a diplomatic mission}}]]

==Vaccination== Many African countries, including [[Angola]], [[Benin]], [[Burkina Faso]], [[Burundi]] [[Cameroon]], [[Central African Republic]], [[Chad]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], [[Republic of the Congo]], [[Côte d'Ivoire]], [[Equatorial Guinea]], [[Gabon]], [[Ghana]], [[Guinea]], [[Guinea-Bissau]], [[Liberia]], [[Mali]], [[Mauritania]], [[Niger]], [[Rwanda]], [[São Tomé and Príncipe]], [[Senegal]], [[Sierra Leone]], [[Togo]], [[Uganda]], and [[Zambia]] require all incoming passengers to have a current [[International Certificate of Vaccination]]. Almost all other African countries and some Asian and Latin American countries require vaccination if the passenger is coming from an infected area.<ref>[http://www.who.int/ith/chapters/ith2012en_annexes.pdf Countries with risk of yellow fever transmission and countries requiring yellow fever vaccination]</ref>
==Passport validity== Passport validity is the length of time passports issued by the Republic of [[Lebanon]] can be used to travel to another country, or be used as a valid form of identification within or outside the Republic of Lebanon before its date of [[wikt:expiration|expiration]].
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Passport validity ! Country or territory |- | At least 1 year | Democratic Republic of the Congo, Togo. |- | At least 9 months | Angola. |- | At least 6 months | Abkhazia, Afghanistan, Algeria, Anguilla, Bahrain, Bhutan, Botswana, British Virgin Islands, Brunei, Cambodia, Cameroon, Cayman Islands, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Côte d'Ivoire, Curaçao, Ecuador, Egypt, El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea, Fiji, Gabon, Guinea Bissau, Guyana, Indonesia, Iran, flag|Iraq (except when arriving at [[Basra International Airport|Basra]] - 3 months and [[Erbil International Airport|Erbil]] or [[Sulaimaniyah International Airport|Sulaimaniyah]]), Jordan, Kenya, Kiribati, Laos, Madagascar, Malaysia, Marshall Islands, Micronesia, Myanmar, Namibia, Nicaragua, Nigeria, Oman, Palau, Papua New Guinea, Philippines, Qatar, Rwanda, Saint Lucia, Samoa, Saudi Arabia, Singapore, Solomon Islands, Somalia, Somaliland, Sri Lanka, Suriname, Taiwan, Tanzania, Thailand, Timor-Leste, Tokelau, Tonga, Turkey, Tuvalu, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, Vanuatu, Venezuela, Vietnam, Yemen, Zimbabwe. |- | At least 4 months | Zambia. |- | At least 3 months | European Union, Albania, Belarus, Georgia, Honduras, Iceland, Kuwait, Moldova, Monaco, Nauru, Panama, Saint Barthélemy, San Marino. |- | At least 45 days | Bermuda |- | At least 1 month | Eritrea, Hong Kong, Macau, New Zealand, South Africa. |- | Valid on exit | Andorra, Congo, Lesotho, Pitcairn Island, Sint Maarten, Turks and Caicos Islands, Ukraine. |}
==Fingerprinting== Several countries including [[Afghanistan]], [[Argentina]], [[Burundi]], [[Cambodia]], [[Ethiopia]], [[Japan]], [[Kenya]], [[Malaysia]], [[Rwanda]], [[Saudi Arabia]], [[South Korea]] and the [[United States]] demand all passengers to be [[fingerprint]]ed on arrival.<ref name="auswaertiges-amt.de"/><ref>http://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/20/world/asia/in-afghanistan-big-plans-to-gather-biometric-data.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0</ref><ref>[http://infosurhoy.com/en_GB/articles/saii/features/main/2012/09/27/feature-01 Argentina strengthens migratory control]</ref><ref>[http://www.reuters.com/article/2007/11/20/us-japan-fingerprinting-idUST23858020071120 Japan fingerprints foreigners as anti-terror move]</ref><ref>[http://english.peopledaily.com.cn/90001/90777/90851/7122530.html S Korea to scan fingerprints of suspicious foreign visitors]</ref><ref>[http://travel.state.gov/travel/cis_pa_tw/cis/cis_1080.html#entry_requirements Cambodia Country Specific Information]</ref><ref>[http://travel.state.gov/travel/cis_pa_tw/cis/cis_960.html#entry_requirements Malaysia Country Specific Information]</ref><ref>[http://secureidnews.com/news-item/saudi-arabia-mandates-fingerprints-and-biometrics-for-foreigners/ Saudi Arabia mandates fingerprints and biometrics for foreigners]</ref><ref>[https://www.dhs.gov/obim Office of Biometric Identity Management]</ref>
==Biometric Data Gathering== Countries capturing other biometric data like iris pattern include [[Jordan]],<ref name="safran-group.com">[http://www.safran-group.com/site-safran-en/press-media/press-releases/2008-448/article/selection-of-sagem-securite-iris?3317]</ref> [[Oman]],<ref name="safran-group.com"/> and the [[United Arab Emirates]].<ref>http://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/DE/Laenderinformationen/00-SiHi/VereinigteArabischeEmirateSicherheit.html</ref>
==Rejection of Lebanese passports== Passports issued by the Republic of [[Lebanon]] are recognized by all the countries and territories in the world. Albeit, in some rare cases, citizens of the Republic of [[Lebanon]] might be refused entry. Most common situations are: * Evidence of travel to [[Israel]] * Evidence of travel to the [[Nagorno-Karabakh Republic]] * Armenian name or ancestry * [[Persona non grata]]
Failure of meeting the criteria required on entrance by a specific country/territory is not an act of rejection of the passports issued by the Republic of [[Lebanon]]
===Evidence of travel to [[Israel]]=== Visitors with an Israeli [[passport stamp]] or visa will likely be refused entry to the following countries:<ref name="timaticweb.com">https://www.timaticweb.com/cgi-bin/tim_website_client.cgi?SpecData=1&VISA=&page=visa&NA=FR&AR=00&PASSTYPES=PASS&DE=IQ&user=KLMB2C&subuser=KLMB2C</ref><ref name="austarab.com.au">http://www.austarab.com.au/visa-info</ref><ref name="uppersia.com">https://www.uppersia.com/Iran-travel-QA/can-a-person-enter-iran-with-an-israeli-immigration-stamp-in-heir-passport.html</ref><ref name="travel.gc.ca">http://travel.gc.ca/destinations/qatar#entryexit</ref><ref>http://travel.gc.ca/destinations/saudi-arabia#entryexit</ref><ref>https://www.timaticweb.com/cgi-bin/tim_website_client.cgi?SpecData=1&VISA=&page=visa&NA=FR&AR=00&PASSTYPES=PASS&DE=SD&user=KLMB2C&subuser=KLMB2C</ref><ref>https://www.timaticweb.com/cgi-bin/tim_website_client.cgi?SpecData=1&VISA=&page=visa&NA=FR&AR=00&PASSTYPES=PASS&DE=YE&user=KLMB2C&subuser=KLMB2C</ref><ref>http://travel.gc.ca/destinations/kuwait#entryexit</ref><ref>http://travel.gc.ca/destinations/libya#entryexit</ref><ref>http://travel.gc.ca/destinations/oman#entryexit</ref> {|style=" {{border-radius|1em}} {{box-shadow|0.1em|0.1em|0.5em|rgba(0,0,0,0.75)}}; background-color: white; border: 1px solid white; padding: 5px;" |- style="vertical-align:top;" | * {{flag|Algeria}} * {{flag|Iran}} * {{flag|Iraq}} * {{flag|Kuwait}} * {{flag|Libya}} * {{flag|Oman}} * {{flag|Qatar}} * {{flag|Sudan}} * {{flag|Syria}} * {{flag|Saudi Arabia}} * {{flag|Yemen}} | |}
Entering Israel by air seems the best option to avoid evidence of travel to Israel in the passport. The border guards from [[Ben Gurion Airport]] in Tel Aviv no longer stamp the passport, instead they issue a small pieces of blue paper that stand for the stay permit and entry stamp and a similar piece or pink paper that stands for exit permit and exit stamp. Entering and leaving Israel by air leaves no evidence of travel there in the passport.
Some border guards of the above countries might take the time to search the passport for evidence of travel to Israel such as entry stamps of Egypt or Jordan from land crossing points on their border with Israel or [[State of Palestine|Palestine]]. The Egyptian or Jordanian entry stamp from the Egyptian-Israeli border or the Jordanian-Israeli border will be considered evidence of travel to Israel and access will be denied with that specific passport.
===Evidence of travel to the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic=== Visitors with a [[passport stamp]] or visa of the [[Nagorno-Karabakh Republic]] are not allowed to enter the following country: * {{flag|Azerbaijan}}
As a result of the [[Nagorno-Karabakh War]] between [[Azerbaijan]] and [[Armenia]], Azerbaijan refuses entry to citizens of the Republic of [[Lebanon]] whose passport shows evidence of entry into the self-proclaimed [[Nagorno-Karabakh Republic]]. Such persons are immediately declared permanent [[Persona non grata|personae non gratae]].
Upon request, the [[Nagorno-Karabakh Republic]] authorities may attach the visa to a separate piece of paper in order to avoid detection of travel to their country.
===Armenian name or ancestry=== [[Azerbaijan]]i authorities refuse entry to a citizen of the Republic of [[Lebanon]] and any other country if they have an Armenian name or are of Armenian descent.
===Persona non grata=== The government of a country can declare a diplomat of the Republic of [[Lebanon]] [[persona non grata]], banning their access into the country. In non-diplomatic use, the authorities of a foreign country may declare a citizen of the Republic of [[Lebanon]] [[persona non grata]] permanently or temporarily.
